t: For the choir director: with the flutes. A psalm of David.
Listen*pn to my words, Lord;*s consider*ln my sighing.
Pay*ln attention to the sound of my cry, my*ln King and my God, for*ln I pray to you.
In*pn the morning, Lord,*s you hear my voice; in*ln the morning I plead my case to you and watch expectantly.
For*pn you are not a God who delights in wickedness; evil*ln cannot dwell with you.
The*ln boastful cannot stand in your sight; you*ln hate all evildoers.
You*ln destroy those who tell lies; the*ln Lord*s abhors violent and treacherous people.
But*pn I enter your house by*ln the abundance of your faithful love; I*ln bow down toward your holy temple in*ln reverential awe of you.
Lord,*sln lead me in your righteousness because*ln of my adversaries; make*ln your way straight before me.
For*pn there is nothing reliable in what they say; destruction*ln is within them; their*ln throat is an open grave; they*ln flatter with their tongues.
Punish*ln them, God; let*ln them fall by their own schemes. Drive*ln them out because of their many crimes, for*ln they rebel against you.
But*pn let all who take refuge in you rejoice; let*ln them shout for joy forever. May*ln you shelter them, and*ln may those who love your name boast about you.
For*ln you, Lord,*s bless the righteous one; you*ln surround him with favor like a shield.
